<SBODY>3 5 9
<ENAMEX TYPE="EVENT.xlife">DEED</ENAMEX>. -- <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">Full Co.</ENAMEX>
This <ENAMEX TYPE="EVENT.xlife">Indenture</ENAMEX>, Made the
<TIMEX TYPE="DATE">First day of August in the year of our Lord one
thousand eight hundred and seventy Eighty two</TIMEX> Between <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">William C. Hodge W</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Helen M Hody</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">his</ENAMEX> of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">City of Buffalo</ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">County of Erie</ENAMEX> and <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">State of New York</ENAMEX>
of the first part,
and <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Adelaide C. Howe</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="FAMILYMEMBER">wife</ENAMEX> of <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Charles M. Howe</ENAMEX> of the same place
of the second part, Witnesseth that the said parties of the first part, for and in consideration of the sum of
<NUMEX TYPE="MONEY">Thirteen Thousand Dollars ( $1300000</NUMEX>
lawful money of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">United States of America</ENAMEX>, to <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">them</ENAMEX> in hand paid by the said party of the second part at or before the ensealing and delivery of
into the receipt whereof is hereby acknowledged, and the said party of the second part,
<ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">ther</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">heirs</ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">executor</ENAMEX>
ors and <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">administrators</ENAMEX>, forever
read and discharged from the same, by these presents have <ENAMEX TYPE="EVENT.xlife">granted, bargained, sold aliened, remised, released, conveyed and confirmed</ENAMEX>, and by these
presents do grant bargain, <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">sell, allen</ENAMEX>, remise, <ENAMEX TYPE="EVENT.xlife">release, convey and confirm</ENAMEX> unto the said party
of the second part, and to
forever, ant that certain pover or parcel of land situate in the   aforesaid, and being part of Farm Lot fifty seven ( 5) <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE.notgpe">Township Eleven </ENAMEX>
and <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE.notgpe">Range Eight</ENAMEX> ( 8) of the so called <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE.notgpe">Holland Land Companys</ENAMEX> survey and 
bounded and described as follows: Commencing at a point in the northerly
line of <ENAMEX TYPE="STRUCTURE">Hodge Avenue</ENAMEX> <NUMEX TYPE="QUANTITY">one hundred and fifty-five and one quarter</NUMEX> ( 155 Westerly from the intersection of the said Northerly line of <ENAMEX TYPE="STRUCTURE">Hodge Avenue</ENAMEX> with the 
westerly line of land heretofore deeded to <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Fannie A. Castle</ENAMEX> by deed bearing date 
<TIMEX TYPE="DATE">October Seventh one thousand eight hundred and forty eight</TIMEX> and recorded in
pollice of the <ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">Clerk</ENAMEX> of the said <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">County of Erie</ENAMEX> in Liber 181 of Deeds at page 332
running thence northerly and at right angler with the said northerly line of
<ENAMEX TYPE="STRUCTURE">Hodge Avenue</ENAMEX> <NUMEX TYPE="QUANTITY">one hundred and fifty ( 150)</NUMEX> feet running thence westerly and
parallel with the said Northerly line of <ENAMEX TYPE="STRUCTURE">Hodge Avenue</ENAMEX> <NUMEX TYPE="QUANTITY">one hundred ( 150)</NUMEX> feet
running thence southerly and at right angles with the said Northerly line of
<ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">Pheenue</ENAMEX> <NUMEX TYPE="MONEY">one hundred and Thirty $180</NUMEX>) feet to the said Northerly line of
<ENAMEX TYPE="STRUCTURE">Hodge Avenue</ENAMEX> running thence easterly and along the said Northerly line of
Hold Avenue <NUMEX TYPE="QUANTITY">one hundred ( 100)</NUMEX> feet to the <ENAMEX TYPE="EVENT.rel">die</ENAMEX> of beginning
feter with all and singular, the tenements, hereditaments and appurtenances thereunto belonging or in any wise appertaining and the reversion and
revertions, remainder and remainders, rents, issues and pronts thereof, <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Hamm</ENAMEX> also, all the estate right, titia <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Hearst</ENAMEX>, Tower
However, as well in Law as <ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">M Equity</ENAMEX>, of the said parties of the first part, of in or
to the above described premises, and every part and parcel thereof, with the appurtenances. In fair and to hold, all and singular, the above mentioned
and described premises, together with the appurtenances unto the said party of the second part, <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">her</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">heirs</ENAMEX> and <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">assigns</ENAMEX> forever. on the line C.  all when <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">he</ENAMEX> said party of the second part, <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">his</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">heirs</ENAMEX> and <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">assigns</ENAMEX>
that the said <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">William C. Hodge</ENAMEX>
at the time of the sealing
and delivery of these presents, was lawfully seized in and possessed of a good, absolute and indefeasible estate of inheritance in fee simple, of and
in all and singular, the above granted, bargained and described premises, with the appurtenances
and has
good right,
all power and lawful authority to grant bargain, sell and convey the same in manner and form aforesaid
and that the said party of the second part, <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">her</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">heirs</ENAMEX> and <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">assigns</ENAMEX>, shall and may at all times hereafter, peaceably and quietly, have, hold, use.
occupy possess and enjoy the above granted premises, and every part and parcel thereof, with the appurtenances, without any let suit, trouble molestation,
eviction or disturbance of the said parties of the first part <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">their</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">heirs</ENAMEX> or <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">assigns</ENAMEX>, or of any other person or persons lawfully claiming or to claim the same.
and that the same now are free, clear, discharged and unincumbered, of and from all former and other grants, titles, charges, estates, judgments, taxes,
assessments and incumbrances of what nature or kind soever. except as above stated
and also, that the said parties of the first part, and <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">her</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">heirs</ENAMEX>, and all and every other person or persons <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">whomsoever</ENAMEX> lawfully or equitably de-
ing <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">my</ENAMEX> estate right, title of interest of in or to the hereinbefore granted premises by from under or in that for <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">him</ENAMEX> or either <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">them</ENAMEX>, shall and will
time or times hereafter, upon the reasonable request, and at the proper costs and charges in the law, of the said party of the second part, <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">her</ENAMEX>
<ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">heirs</ENAMEX> and <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">assigns</ENAMEX>, make, do and execute, or cause or procure to be made, done and executed, all and every such further and other lawful and reasonable acts,
conveyances and assurances in the law, for the better and more effectually vesting and confirming the premises hereby intended to be granted, in and to the said
party of the second part, <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">her</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">heirs</ENAMEX> and <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">assigns</ENAMEX> forever, as by the said party of the second part, <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">her</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">heirs</ENAMEX> or <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">assigns</ENAMEX>, or <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">her</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">counsel</ENAMEX> learned
in the law, shall be reasonably devised, advised or required. And the said <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">William C. Hodge</ENAMEX> and <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">his</ENAMEX>
haire the above described and hereby granted and released premises, and every part and parcel thereof with the appurtenances hereby warrant
party of the second part <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">their</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">heirs</ENAMEX> and <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">assigns</ENAMEX>, against the said parties of the first part, and <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">heir</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">heirs</ENAMEX>, and against all and every person and
persons <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">whomsoever</ENAMEX> lawfully claiming or to claim the same, simil and will endurait, and by these presents forever Wittent.
In <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE.notgpe">Thitness Sherret</ENAMEX>, The parties to these presents have hereunto interchangeably set <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">their</ENAMEX> hands and seals, the <TIMEX TYPE="COREF.dat">day and year first above written</TIMEX>.
<ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">William C. Hodge</ENAMEX>
Sealed and Delivered in Presence of
<ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Helen M. Hodge</ENAMEX>
<ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">STATE OF NEW YORK</ENAMEX>.
 SS.
<ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">Elie COUNTY</ENAMEX>,)
<ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Thill</ENAMEX>    <TIMEX TYPE="DATE">Eleventh day of October 1899</TIMEX>, before <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">me</ENAMEX> the subscriber appeared
was acknowledged that the executed the <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF.gen">woman</ENAMEX> instrument, and forty that now the  executed the within instrument.
<ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Willard Stay Hodge</ENAMEX>
<ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">Notary Public</ENAMEX>
in & for <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">Erie Co.</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">N. Y.</ENAMEX>
<ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">STATE OF NEW YORK</ENAMEX>,
<ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">Cowry</ENAMEX>, a
day of
18, before <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">me</ENAMEX>, the subscriber, appeared
On this
<ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">his</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="FAMILYMEMBER">wife</ENAMEX>, and
and severally acknowle.
ledged that <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">they</ENAMEX> had executed the within instrument; and the said
or compulsion of <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">her</ENAMEX> said <ENAMEX TYPE="FAMILYMEMBER">husband</ENAMEX>. And <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">I</ENAMEX> further
4 acknowledged that <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">she</ENAMEX> executed the within instrument freely, and without any fear or of
on a private examination, apart from <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">her</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="FAMILYMEMBER">husband</ENAMEX>, <NUMEX TYPE="QUANTITY">one</NUMEX>
certify that <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">I</ENAMEX> know the persons <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">who</ENAMEX> made the said acknowledgment to be the individuals described in and <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">who</ENAMEX> executed the within instrument.
And the said <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">William C. Hodge</ENAMEX> for <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">himself</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">his</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">heirs</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">executors</ENAMEX> and <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">administrators</ENAMEX>
does hereby covenant to the said second party that at the time of the sealing and 
delivery of these presents that the above described premises were   unencumbered W <ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">Capt</ENAMEX> by a certain Mortgage for <NUMEX TYPE="MONEY">Five Thousand Dollars</NUMEX> said <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">William C. Hodge</ENAMEX> and <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Helen M. Hodge</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">his</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="FAMILYMEMBER">wife</ENAMEX> to <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Jane C.</ENAMEX> <TIMEX TYPE="DATE">1882</TIMEX> - and recorded in <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">Erie County</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">Clerk</ENAMEX>'s office in Liber  of and which said Mortgage the said <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Adelaide E. Howe</ENAMEX> hire__<TIMEX TYPE="DATE">1882</TIMEX>, at <ENAMEX TYPE="AGE">144</ENAMEX>
</SBODY>
